job_details.Vacaturetitel: Senior Linux Systems Engineer (On-Premise and Cloud)
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
* You will work in a team of highly skilled engineers, to:
     * Achieve uptime >99.99%.
     * Manage and expand the physical servers, OS's and networks in multiple datacenters, including our AWS cloud platforms.
     * Understand a complex technical architecture with a high degree of customisation.
     * Operate and improve our automation tooling.
     * Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation schedule.
     * Provide a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company
     * Work with a DevOps mindset with other teams within the company to bring our products to a large number of corporate customers worldwide.
     * Manage & Support our Cloud Infrastructure to:
     * Design, deploy (via Terraform), and manage AWS cloud infrastructure components (EC2 instances, VPC, EKS, S3, EFS, etc.).
     * Optimize cloud resources for cost efficiency and performance.
     * Monitor and maintain high availability and fault tolerance of cloud services.
     * Ensure compliance with security best practices and industry standards.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Linux Systems Engineer (On-Premise and Cloud)

* You will work in a team of highly skilled engineers, to:
     * Achieve uptime >99.99%.
     * Manage and expand the physical servers, OS's and networks in multiple datacenters, including our AWS cloud platforms.
     * Understand a complex technical architecture with a high degree of customisation.
     * Operate and improve our automation tooling.
     * Participate in 24/7 on-call rotation schedule.
     * Provide a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company
     * Work with a DevOps mindset with other teams within the company to bring our products to a large number of corporate customers worldwide.
     * Manage & Support our Cloud Infrastructure to:
     * Design, deploy (via Terraform), and manage AWS cloud infrastructure components (EC2 instances, VPC, EKS, S3, EFS, etc.).
     * Optimize cloud resources for cost efficiency and performance.
     * Monitor and maintain high availability and fault tolerance of cloud services.
     * Ensure compliance with security best practices and industry standards.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional systems engineering, infrastructure management (Linux, servers, networks, datacenters), and cloud operations (AWS, Terraform, EC2, VPC, EKS, S3, EFS). While it mentions a 'DevOps mindset' and 'automation tooling', there is no mention of AI, machine learning, generative models, LLMs, or related technologies. The core responsibilities are centered around infrastructure reliability, scalability, and cost optimization, which are characteristic of a Systems Engineer or DevOps Engineer role, not an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category as it is not an AI-specific technical role.

job_tasks.justification: The description emphasizes achieving high uptime (>99.99%), managing and improving automation tooling, participating in on-call rotations, and providing flexible infrastructure, which are all core aspects of operations engineering and MLOps, albeit in a broader infrastructure context.
Managing and improving automation tooling is a key responsibility in operations engineering to ensure efficiency and reliability.
job_tasks.phrase: Operate and improve our automation tooling

job_tasks.justification: Participating in a 24/7 on-call rotation is a standard duty for operations and SRE roles responsible for maintaining system availability.
The phrase 'DevOps mindset' directly relates to the principles and practices of operations engineering, focusing on collaboration and efficiency between development and operations.
Managing and supporting cloud infrastructure, including design, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance for high availability and fault tolerance, falls under operations engineering.
Deploying infrastructure using Terraform is a core practice in infrastructure as code and operations engineering.
Monitoring and maintaining high availability and fault tolerance are critical aspects of operations engineering to ensure system reliability.
job_tasks.phrase: Monitor and maintain high availability and fault tolerance of cloud services

job_tasks.justification: Ensuring compliance with security best practices and industry standards is a key responsibility in maintaining secure and reliable infrastructure operations.
job_tasks.phrase: Ensure compliance with security best practices and industry standards

job_tasks.justification: While the primary focus is infrastructure, the design and deployment of cloud infrastructure components can involve software development principles, especially in defining and managing infrastructure as code.
job_tasks.phrase: Design, deploy (via Terraform), and manage AWS cloud infrastructure components

job_tasks.justification: Understanding a complex technical architecture with a high degree of customisation is crucial for aligning infrastructure decisions with business needs and ensuring effective support.
job_tasks.phrase: Understand a complex technical architecture with a high degree of customisation

job_tasks.justification: Providing a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company implies understanding and meeting the diverse needs of different business units.
job_tasks.phrase: Provide a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company

soft_skills.phrase: Work with a DevOps mindset with other teams within the company
Optimize cloud resources for cost efficiency and performance
Operate and improve our automation tooling
Provide a flexible infrastructure to the rest of the company
